byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: Chaos in Great Britain's Conservative and Labour Parties has raised prospect of another general election, which could be held as soon as coming fall, in order to solidify political landscape following so-called Brexit vote; candidates who want to succeed Prime Min David Cameron are putting their names up for consideration in Conservative Party, and Labour members have tried to oust leader Jeremy Corbyn in light of possibility of general election.

headline.print_headline: With Both Parties in Turmoil, Britain Weighs a General Election
headline.main: With Both Parties in Turmoil, Britain Weighs a General Election

snippet: A successor to Prime Minister David Cameron might want to seek his or her own mandate from voters after the decision to exit the European Union.
lead_paragraph: A successor to Prime Minister David Cameron might want to seek his or her own mandate from voters after the decision to exit the European Union.
